Detailed Description

The class CallHdlBase is the base class for single call objectes ( CallHdl) and multi-party call objects (MptyCallHdl) and comprises besides some virtual methods, methods which are commen to single and multi-party calls.

Member Function Documentation

void CallHdlBase::ClearBlacklist (   )  [static]
 

Initiates the manual clearing of the blacklist, i.e., every called party number is removed from the blacklist and the corresponding timers are reset.

INT CallHdlBase::GetCallCount (   )  [static]
 

Returns the current number of calls, where a multi-party call is considered as one call. A call in setup phase is also considered as one call. Example: An active multi-party call exists and a mobile terminated call arrives: GetCallCount returns 2.

Returns:
The current number of calls.

virtual TimeSpan CallHdlBase::GetCallDuration (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Returns a TimeSpan object for the duration of the call represented by a CallHdl ore MptyCallHdl. The method is applicable to both MptyCallHdl and CallHdl.

Returns:
A zero value if the CallHdl/MptyCallHdl is not valid. Also zero if a single call has not been successfully established. The time span from the successful establishment of of a single call or multiparty call to the time of execution of this method.

Implemented in CallHdl, and MptyCallHdl.

virtual CallIndex CallHdlBase::GetCallIndex (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Implemented in CallHdl, and MptyCallHdl.

virtual DateTime CallHdlBase::GetStartTime (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Returns a DateTime object representing the time at the point when the call was established. GetStartTime() may be applied to a CallHdl or MptyCallHdl object.

Returns:
The time when the call was established.

Implemented in CallHdl, and MptyCallHdl.

CallApiRc CallHdlBase::Join (   )  [virtual]
 

Creates a multi party call from a held and an active call, or adds an active call to an existing multi party call. The method may be applied to the mulity-party or the single call.
Refer to the documentation of CallApiRc for a detailed description of the return values.

Returns:
NoError if Join was successfully executed. In case of an error one of the following values will be returned: CallDataLocked, ActiveCallRequired, HeldCallRequired, MaxMptyMemberCountExceeded, VoidCallIndex, CallDisconnected, SupplementaryServiceFailed.

CallErrorCause CallHdlBase::ReadLastMnCause (   )  [static]
 

CallApiRc CallHdlBase::RejectAllMoc (  BOOLEAN  activate  )  [static]
 

Enables/disables blocking of all mobile originated calls. If enabled the MN will reject all mobile terminated call setups with cause #21 'call rejected'.

Parameters:
activate TRUE activates, FALSE deactivates blocking.
Returns:
NoError - If blocking successfully enabled or disabled. CallDataLocked if another thread currently blocks the internal data structures.

CallApiRc CallHdlBase::RejectAllMtc (  BOOLEAN  activate  )  [static]
 

Enables/disables blocking of all mobile terminated calls. If enabled the MN will reject all mobile terminated call setups with cause #21 'call rejected'.

Parameters:
activate TRUE activates, FALSE deactivates blocking.
Returns:
NoError - If blocking successfully enabled or disabled. CallDataLocked if another thread currently blocks the internal data structures.

CallApiRc CallHdlBase::ReleaseAllActiveCalls (   )  [static]
 

Releases all active calls if existent. Used in connection with call related supplementary services.

CallApiRc CallHdlBase::ReleaseAllHeldCalls (   )  [static]
 

Releases all held calls if existent. Used in connection with call related supplementary services.

void CallHdlBase::ReportCurrentCallMeter (  BOOLEAN  activate  )  [static]
 

Starts the automatic reporting of the current call meter (CCM). The ASC message CurrentCallMeterMsg will be sent each time when the CCM is calculated (but not more than once within 2 seconds) until the automatic reporting is stopped by calling this method with parameter activate set to FALSE.

Parameters:
activate Starts reporting of CCM if TRUE, stops reporting if FALSE.

void CallHdlBase::ReportCurrentCharge (  BOOLEAN  activate  )  [static]
 

Starts the automatic reporting of the current charge. The ASC message CurrentChargeMsg will be sent each time when the CCM is calculated (but not more than once within 2 seconds) until the automatic reporting is stopped by calling this method with parameter activate set to FALSE.

Parameters:
activate Starts reporting of current charge if TRUE, stops reporting if FALSE.

void CallHdlBase::SetRediallingEnable (  BOOLEAN  action  )  [static]
 

This method enables/disables the internal redialling mechanism.

Parameters:
action TRUE enables the internal redialling mechanism, FALSE disables the mechanism.

virtual CallApiRc CallHdlBase::StartDtmfToneGeneration (  KeyCode  key  )  [inline, virtual]
 

Starts the generation of a DTMF tone during an active voice call. Refer to the documentation of CallApiRc for a detailed description of the return values.

Parameters:
key A KeyCode 0, 1, ... 9, * or #.
Returns:
NoError - If successful. In case of an error, one of the following values is returned: CallDataLocked, VoidCallIndex, InvalidCallIndex, ActiveCallRequired, SpeechCallRequired, InvalidMptyMemberCount,

Reimplemented in CallHdl, and MptyCallHdl.

virtual CallApiRc CallHdlBase::StopDtmfToneGeneration (   )  [inline, virtual]
 

Stops the started generation of a DTMF tone.

Returns:
See CallHdl::StartDtmfToneGeneration(...).

Reimplemented in CallHdl, and MptyCallHdl.

CallApiRc CallHdlBase::Swap (   )  [virtual]
 

SwapCalls() holds the active call, retrieves the held call and returns NoError in case of success. The method may be applied to the active or held call. A held and an active call are required, one of them may be a multy-party call. The method is applicable to both, CallHdl and MptyCallHdl objects. The error indication is analogue to the error indication of Hold and Retrieve since Swap() is the consecutive execution of Hold() and Retrieve().
Refer to the documentation of CallApiRc for a detailed description of the return values.

Returns:
NoError if the operation was successfully excuted. In case of an error one of the following values will be returned: CallDataLocked, ActiveCallRequired, HeldCallRequired, InvalidCallIndex, VoidCallIndex, CallDisconnected, SupplementaryServiceFailed, HoldRequestRejected, RetrieveRequestRejected.
